problem.display_name: What do you think of Owl's Solution?

p.strong: How is the truss bridge similar to and different from the cable-stayed bridge?

div.p: Owl decided to build a truss bridge this time. A truss bridge tends to be stiffer than a cable-stayed bridge, meaning that it will deflect less when loaded. I hope that Owl paid close attention to the connections to the trees. This is a scenario where I'd want to design a bridge that allowed for movement on one end. A statically determinate bridge with a pinned connection on one end and a roller support on the other that allowed for lots of differential motion between the trees would be ideal.
